messages: edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:55): I think DOM Core should define Events (just the infrastructure), Nodes, probably Event Loops and Mutation Events, and maybe event handlers
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (12:56): Mmm mutation events
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (12:58): Mmm implementation reports
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (12:59): Hmm ice cream
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:07): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: What's with the recent blogpost re XML? I don't quite gather what happened prior to that.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:10): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, I got frustrated with the continued bashing from the XML community
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:11): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: I wasn't aware of that at all. I thought XML5 was coming along nicely?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:11): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, e.g. http://twitter.com/#!/ndw/status/35097590135525376
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:11): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, oh, it seems that has some traction for sure
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:12): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, but meanwhile what we try to do with HTML gets us mostly flames and roadblocks
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:12): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Well, some resistance is to be expected.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:12): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e: Don't give up. I like the direction the HTML/WebApp specs are taking.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:12): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, it is a bit lame of course to complain about unfairness on your blog, but I felt I could do it once
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:12): Sure. You're entitled ;)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): http://conversations.nokia.com/2011/02/11/open-letter-from-ceo-stephen-elop-nokia-and-ceo-steve-ballmer-microsoft/?mobile -- two failing giants team up
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:16): I wonder what that will do
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:17): wow  that video is lame
7f9405da4034bf43083e64b57302a8e6 (13:25): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, its a shame. the n900 had awesome stuff eons before android came along and nokia failed it.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:36): Ballmer's voice has seen better days.
da5121879fff54b08b69ec54d9ac2bf6 (13:38): The N900 rocks, but it seems this will be my last Nokia phone. |c:
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:39): What OS has Nokia been using before?
da5121879fff54b08b69ec54d9ac2bf6 (13:40): Several.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:45): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, is this going to be the moment where you'll become more actively involved in standards btw?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:46): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, assuming I guessed correctly which website you are associated with I've always hoped that to be the case :)
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:46): Erm... what would that be then? I think you're mistaking me for somebody else.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:47): http://plasmasturm.org/
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:47): That's interesting, but not me.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:48): ah, too bad
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:48): I get that a lot.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:48): Sorry for being just me ;)
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:48): you're most welcome for just being you :)
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:50): Nah, I'm just a regular web dev. My name is in the HTML acknowledgments and that's the biggest achievment I can show.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:50): hmm
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:50): 9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa, that's how most people start out ;)

edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:51): the hmm was for DOM Events btw... which does not specify what multiple calls to addEventListener does and which listener will be removed if you then do removeEventListener

9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:51): At least it's something I can put in my resume. Hixie helped me figure out I contributed _something_ to Web Forms 2. Still not sure of what it was exactly, but apparently I was noticed.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:52): heh
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:52): I started there too
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:52): Sounds like addEventListener/removeEventListener expects there to be exactly one listener, as was the norm back in the days.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:52): type=uri was my proposal, until I realized it should really be type=url
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:53): No love for urns?
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:53): love for consistency with terms we use elsewhere
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:53): CSS uses url()
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:55): true
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (13:56): Probably most people don't start out with their name in the spec as their first achievement
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:57): well look at that
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:58): the way I defined it for http://dev.w3.org/csswg/cssom-view/#the-mediaquerylist-interface matches how DOM Events actually work
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:58): cannot insert duplicate event listeners
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (13:58): I have a faint recollection I reverse engineered it back then to make sure it was consistent

9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (13:58): Most of my involvement is historical at best anyway. I tend to the forum on occasion and follow the whatwg mailing list, but my activity peaked somewhere around six years ago.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:00): well, if you ever want to get "serious" about this, it seems to be rather easy to get employed doing something with standards these days
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:00): These days I mostly just shout at people who do it wrong, tbh.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:00): readonly attribute DOMString matches;
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:00): it's like "1) passion 2) ... 3) job"
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:01): The matches must return true...
06cb330920ae58e1614c9145d983b3d6 (14:01): the best pattern, when you manage to stumble upon "..." :P
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:01): Sounds like a boolean to me
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:01): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81, nobody reads my specs :)

9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:01): Well, yeah, I call it "evangelism" to make it sound more legit. But most of what I do is follow standards and point out when people don't know what they're doing.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:01): edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e, yeah, I'm weird like that ;)

9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:03): I already supported web standards before the WaSP became a bunch of guys shouting at kids to keep off their lawn. Actually, the WaSP didn't even exist back then.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:04): But, yes. I prefer following standards over writing them, so I guess I'll stick with what I do best.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:22): oh look
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:22): http://dvcs.w3.org/hg/domcore/raw-file/tip/Overview.html#events
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:22): 8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 ran an update
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:24): rewriting a spec is a good way of discovering holes in the old copy
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:25): I guess that's why a lot of people want a rewrite of CSS
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:25): No, that's because CSS is unreadable

9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:34): I can't wait for the "let's implement Sass in the browser and pretend it's still CSS" stuff scheduled for later this year. I'm seriously looking forward to that.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:34): Sass?
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:34): sass-lang.com
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:35): i.e. native variables and nesting in CSS.
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:35): If that's a prank, I'm going to kill whoever started it, though.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:36): The WG has been working on variables for a long time, but we've never had a draft browsers agreed to implement
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:38): Well, it'd be blatantly backwards-incompatible, but if it sees the light of day before IE9 is out, it might have a chance.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:38): it's not going in IE9
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:39): Damn.
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:39): IE9 is going out Real Soon Now, no?
9f3f1fad40de2a412fd933b14da8b0fa (14:39): Here's to another ten years of wishing for IE to die, then. MS made it pretty clear they think not forcing upgrades is a good thing.
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:45): geez
edb259c0e0038f38bb200bc20c8cbf7e (14:45): Event.timeStamp is useful...
8b3687499080633e1898fa1dd209ef81 (14:45): takes a deep breath and processes it like any other end tag below
